name: Frillish
entry: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.

name: Jellicent
entry: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

name: Alomomola
entry: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

name: Joltik
entry: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

name: Galvantula
entry: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

name: Ferroseed
entry: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

name: Ferrothorn
entry: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.

name: Klink
entry: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

name: Klang
entry: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.

name: Klinklang
entry: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

name: Tynamo
entry: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

name: Eelektrik
entry: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

name: Eelektross
entry: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

name: Elgyem
entry: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.

name: Beheeyem
entry: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.

name: Litwick
entry: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

name: Lampent
entry: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.

name: Chandelure
entry: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.

name: Axew
entry: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

name: Fraxure
entry: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.

name: Haxorus
entry: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

name: Cubchoo
entry: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.

name: Beartic
entry: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

name: Cryogonal
entry: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.

name: Shelmet
entry: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.

name: Accelgor
entry: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

name: Stunfisk
entry: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

name: Mienfoo
entry: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

name: Mienshao
entry: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.

name: Druddigon
entry: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

name: Golett
entry: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

name: Golurk
entry: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

name: Pawniard
entry: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

name: Bisharp
entry: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.

name: Bouffalant
entry: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

name: Rufflet
entry: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

name: Braviary
entry: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

name: Vullaby
entry: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.

name: Mandibuzz
entry: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

name: Heatmor
entry: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.

name: Durant
entry: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

name: Deino
entry: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.

name: Zweilous
entry: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

name: Hydreigon
entry: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.

name: Larvesta
entry: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.

name: Volcarona
entry: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.

name: Cobalion
entry: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.

name: Terrakion
entry: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.

name: Virizion
entry: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.

name: Tornadus
entry: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

name: Thundurus
entry: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.

name: Reshiram
entry: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

name: Zekrom
entry: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

name: Landorus
entry: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

name: Kyurem
entry: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

name: Keldeo
entry: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.

name: Meloetta
entry: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

name: Genesect
entry: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.

name: Chespin
entry: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

name: Quilladin
entry: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

name: Chesnaught
entry: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

name: Fennekin
entry: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Braixen
entry: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

name: Delphox
entry: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

name: Froakie
entry: Edge_case

name: Frogadier
entry: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

name: Greninja
entry: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

name: Bunnelby
entry: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

name: Diggersby
entry: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.

name: Fletchling
entry: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

name: Fletchinder
entry: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

name: Talonflame
entry: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

name: Scatterbug
entry: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

name: Spewpa
entry: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

name: Vivillon
entry: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

name: Litleo
entry: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

name: Pyroar
entry: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

name: Flabébé
entry: Edge_case

name: Floette
entry: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

name: Florges
entry: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

name: Skiddo
entry: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

name: Gogoat
entry: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

name: Pancham
entry: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

name: Pangoro
entry: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.

name: Furfrou
entry: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

name: Espurr
entry: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

name: Meowstic
entry: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

name: Honedge
entry: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

name: Doublade
entry: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.

name: Aegislash
entry: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

name: Spritzee
entry: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

name: Aromatisse
entry: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.

name: Swirlix
entry: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

name: Slurpuff
entry: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

name: Inkay
entry: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

name: Malamar
entry: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.

name: Binacle
entry: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

name: Barbaracle
entry: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.

name: Skrelp
entry: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

name: Dragalge
entry: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.

name: Clauncher
entry: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.

name: Clawitzer
entry: Edge_case

name: Helioptile
entry: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

name: Heliolisk
entry: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

name: Tyrunt
entry: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.

name: Tyrantrum
entry: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.

name: Amaura
entry: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

name: Aurorus
entry: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.

name: Sylveon
entry: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.

name: Hawlucha
entry: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.

name: Dedenne
entry: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

name: Carbink
entry: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.

name: Goomy
entry: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.

name: Sliggoo
entry: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.

name: Goodra
entry: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

name: Klefki
entry: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

name: Phantump
entry: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.

name: Trevenant
entry: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

name: Pumpkaboo
entry: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

name: Gourgeist
entry: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

name: Bergmite
entry: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

name: Avalugg
entry: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

name: Noibat
entry: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

name: Noivern
entry: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.

name: Xerneas
entry: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

name: Yveltal
entry: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

name: Zygarde
entry: When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.

name: Diancie
entry: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

name: Hoopa
entry: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.

name: Volcanion
entry: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

name: Rowlet
entry: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

name: Dartrix
entry: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

name: Decidueye
entry: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.

name: Litten
entry: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

name: Torracat
entry: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

name: Incineroar
entry: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.

name: Popplio
entry: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.

name: Brionne
entry: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.

name: Primarina
entry: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.

name: Pikipek
entry: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.

name: Trumbeak
entry: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.

name: Toucannon
entry: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.

name: Yungoos
entry: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.

name: Gumshoos
entry: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.

name: Grubbin
entry: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.

name: Charjabug
entry: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.

name: Vikavolt
entry: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.

name: Crabrawler
entry: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.

name: Crabominable
entry: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.

name: Oricorio
entry: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.

name: Cutiefly
entry: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

name: Ribombee
entry: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.

name: Rockruff
entry: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.

name: Lycanroc
entry: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.

name: Wishiwashi
entry: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

name: Mareanie
entry: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

name: Toxapex
entry: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.

name: Mudbray
entry: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.

name: Mudsdale
entry: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.

name: Dewpider
entry: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

name: Araquanid
entry: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

name: Fomantis
entry: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.

name: Lurantis
entry: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.

name: Morelull
entry: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

name: Shiinotic
entry: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.

name: Salandit
entry: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

name: Salazzle
entry: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.

name: Stufful
entry: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

name: Bewear
entry: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

name: Bounsweet
entry: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.

name: Steenee
entry: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.

name: Tsareena
entry: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.

name: Comfey
entry: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.

name: Oranguru
entry: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.

name: Passimian
entry: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.

name: Wimpod
entry: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.

name: Golisopod
entry: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.

name: Sandygast
entry: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.

name: Palossand
entry: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.

name: Pyukumuku
entry: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.

name: Type: Null
entry: Edge_case

name: Silvally
entry: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.

name: Minior
entry: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.

name: Komala
entry: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.

name: Turtonator
entry: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

name: Togedemaru
entry: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.

name: Mimikyu
entry: After going to all the effort of disguising itself, its neck was broken. Whatever is inside is probably unharmed, but it’s still feeling sad.

name: Bruxish
entry: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.

name: Drampa
entry: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.

name: Dhelmise
entry: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.

name: Jangmo-o
entry: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.

name: Hakamo-o
entry: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.

name: Kommo-o
entry: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.

name: Tapu Koko
entry: Edge_case

name: Tapu Lele
entry: Edge_case

name: Tapu Bulu
entry: Edge_case

name: Tapu Fini
entry: Edge_case

name: Cosmog
entry: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

name: Cosmoem
entry: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.

name: Solgaleo
entry: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.

name: Lunala
entry: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.

name: Nihilego
entry: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.

name: Buzzwole
entry: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.

name: Pheromosa
entry: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.

name: Xurkitree
entry: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.

name: Celesteela
entry: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.

name: Kartana
entry: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.

name: Guzzlord
entry: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.

name: Necrozma
entry: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.

name: Magearna
entry: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
